verbs.description: cozen (third-person singular simple present cozens, present participle cozening, simple past and past participle cozened)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To become cozy; (by extension) to become acquainted, comfortable, or familiar with.

description: Perhaps from obsolete Italian cozzonare (“to cheat”), from cozzone (“middleman, broker”), from Latin cōciō (“dealer”).

verbs.description: cozen (third-person singular simple present cozens, present participle cozening, simple past and past participle cozened)

entries.meaning: (archaic) To cheat; to defraud; to deceive, usually by small arts, or in a pitiful way. [from late 16th c.]
